intro: Tibouchina purpusii, commonly known as the purple tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Tibouchina purpusii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sun.
